description.narrative: Kenya’s development cooperation programme consists of three key pillars: 1) enhanced support to trade promotion and private sector engagement informed by and linked to development cooperation objectives; 2) Institutional partnerships, support to sustainable livelihoods and agribusiness contribute to enhanced economic development, 3) Gender Equality is promoted, and science and innovation in education fostered, to increase opportunities for youth and women. Programme quality and support also funded.

The funding will support: 1) private sector development and FDI to promote economic growth including through assistance to KEPSA and KenInvest with a focus on support to women-led businesses and conclusion and evaluation of the Catalytic Fund launched in 2019; 2) implementation of the Ireland Kenya Agri-Food Strategy with a focus on dairy, fisheries and potato initiatives that benefit smallholder farmers, with a particular focus on female farmers, and the Potato Capacity Building programme (IFDC) and climate research programme with Teagasc under IKAFS; 3) national scale-up of Young Scientist Kenya and projects and research into gender and GBV which support women’s economic empowerment and prevention of violence again women and girls.
